meanings.definition: A person who disrupts the peace or order of a situation.
meanings.sent1: The noisy disturber in the library was asked to leave.
meanings.sent2: The disturber at the party kept interrupting conversations.
meanings.sent3: The little disturber made a mess with the toys in the playroom.
meanings.sent4: His sudden outburst was a disturber of the calm atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The disturber's actions caused chaos in the classroom.

meanings.definition: Something that causes disruption or unrest.
meanings.sent1: The barking dog was a disturber of the neighborhood's peace.
meanings.sent2: The storm was a disturber of the outdoor event.
meanings.sent3: The broken alarm clock became a little disturber of their morning routine.
meanings.sent4: The disturbing news was a disturber of their plans.
meanings.sent5: The loud music from the party was a disturber of the quiet night.
